Message.Msg: They will be in hiding. Sales have likely plunged in CA, after the imposition of sales taxes. Costs are rising, and may go much higher if FedEx and UPS raise prices. The economy is slowing. The current PE is above 300 and even the forward PE (based on optimistic forcasts that won't pan out imho) is above 100 (more than 7 times that of Apple). Bottom line: $180 may be optimistic. $140?? It may get there in a hurry, or slowly. That is the question. How long it hovers in value heaven, who know? That depends on the bots.

Message.Title: Expensive Distribution System?
Message.Msg: "Fulfillment centers", air shipping, etc. Costly and moving higher. What happens to the stale inventory? Gathers dust? Wal-mart distribution system is cheaper (uses cheap ground transportation) and results in higher profits. Now Amazon must collect sales taxes, just like Wal-mart, ending that advantage.Customers can get the stuff they need RIGHT AWAY at Walmart--need a day or two from AMZN. The PE is much more reasonable (below 15 vs. 300 for Amazon). How much is a retailor worth? 300 (100 forward) seems a wee bit rich--how about a 25 PE?

Message.Msg: If the "cloud" is all that profitable, many competitors will move in.

Message.Msg: Geeg: You are a trip. Long GOOG call has worked well, no? Long NSPH has returned 250% over the past year... I'm long INTC via April 2013 $25 calls and will double the # of contracts shortly. It's over the head of small minded folks like you, but companies like INTC will be the largest beneficiaries of QE3 in time... And, it is just getting momentum in mobile. I've been right on every short so far, but inevitably the predatory moves in the markets (that's the real story of the market -- it is no longer about fundamentals because it is ALL about funds trying to shake on another out competing for declining AUM) make it take longer than it should. As to your insults on myself and my company, it simply shows what little character you have. Rather than responding to your slanderous allegations, I'll simply take the high road... In time, my little company will be viewed as a phenomenal success story and in the meanwhile, I will continue to self finance it... Competition for Amazon is coming from all sides. It's gonna be a fun year for AMZN shorts...

Message.Title: Huge Success of Amazon Kindle Ads & Shopping from Tablets
Message.Msg: Why isn't Walmart selling Kindles any more? I heard it was because they didn't want to enable a competitor. That can only mean that the ads shorts told me no one wanted to read must have been a huge driver of many more additional sales for Amazon. After all, previously Walmart had no qualms about selling Kindles. And they're not discontinuing the sale of PCs at Walmart which also enable Amazon shoppers, so it must be specific to Kindle. The strategy of driving more sales through tablets must have been a whopping success for Walmart to have taken such a sudden and wide scale reversal on selling Kindles.
